Fallout 3 is an open-world action RPG set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. It places players in the role of a Vault Dweller exploring the remains of Washington, D.C., searching for their father while navigating a dangerous world filled with mutants, raiders, and moral dilemmas.

The game’s standout feature is its immersive world design, combining atmospheric environments with a rich sense of history. The V.A.T.S. system adds a tactical layer to combat, letting players pause and target specific enemy parts. Player choice heavily influences the story, with branching paths and multiple endings that give a personal touch to the experience.

On the downside, the game shows its age with clunky mechanics and frequent bugs that can disrupt immersion. The combat, while innovative, can feel stiff, and the visuals, though atmospheric, may appear dated compared to modern standards. Who must play with mods that stabilize the game experience.

Fallout 3 remains a landmark title for its storytelling and world-building, offering a memorable journey through a desolate yet fascinating landscape.

A must-play for RPG fans, but patience is needed for its quirks. Definetly apply some basic mods to enhance the experice by MILES. No mods: [b]7/10[/b] - With mods: [b]8.5/10[/b](nostalgia bias)

185441917.review:
FO 3 hat mittlerweile einige Jahre auf dem Buckel, von daher werde ich hier an dieser Stelle nicht auf die Grafik eingehen, diese ist einfach nicht gut gealtert und im Vergleich zu modernen Spielen einfach sehr karg. Dafür kann FO3 nichts und wer es wirklich ändern möchte, findet an den üblichen Stellen Mods um das Ganze ein wenig aufzuhübschen.

Der Installationsprozess unter Windows 11 ist nicht so einfach wie man meinen sollte, an einigen Stellen muss man manuell nachhelfen, aber Dank der guten Community und einer Suchmaschine lässt sich auch das in wenigen Minuten erledigen. Positiv sei zu erwähnen, dass man das Spiel auch auf modernen und vor ALlem breiten Monitoren zum laufen bekommt. Performanceprobleme wird man mit einem einigermaßen aktuellen PC (lies: Darf auch gerne sieben bis acht Jahre alt sein) nicht haben.

Musik technisch ist FO3 nicht wirklich gut gestaltet. Zwar kann man sich ingame diverse Radiosender anhören, welche im Übrigen gut gemacht sind und in einem Fall sogar auf die Taten des Spielers reagieren, sonst aber eher simpel gehalten sind. 

Kommen wir damit zum Gameplay. Die Steuerung ist so simpel wie es nur sein kann. Die übliche WASD Kombo mit ein paar Extratasten und das war es schon. Die Reaktion ist präzise und kann an keiner Stelle bemängelt werden. Wer es vorher noch nie benutzt hat, dürfte auch recht zügig mit VATS klar kommen. 

Etwas schwieriger dürfte es für Spieler werden, die noch nie zuvor ein Fallout Spiel vor der Nase hatten und sich komplett neu in die durchaus große Menge Items einarbeiten müssen. Ich selber hatte das Problem nicht, weil ich vorher schon jede Menge New Vegas und FO4 gezockt hatte, aber komplette Neulinge sollten hier etwas Lernwillen und Zeit mitbringen. 

Und damit kommen wir zum springenden Punkt, zum hüfenden Komma, zum Casus Knacksus - den Geschichten, die FO3 erzählt. Und ich schreibe hier extra und bewusst "Geschichten" im Plural, weil die Main Story eher unterdurchschnittlich ist und nicht soviel hergibt, wie man meinen sollte. Und das ist genau der Punkt, wo auch dieser Fallout Teil glänzen kann. Viele Quests sind wirklich liebevoll gebaut, strotzen vor Dialogen, bieten diverse Möglichkeiten zur Lösung und sind praktisch immer unterhaltsam. Das ist einfach großes Kino! An vielen Stellen werden sogar Geschichten erzählt, ohne ein Wort Text an den SPieler zu bringen. Es werden Situationen geschaffen, die eine Geschichte erahnen lassen, eventuell sogar eine Geschichte ergänzen, die irgendwo vorher mal in einem Terminal erwähnt wurde. Das ist richtig gut.

Da ich hier die GOTY bewerte, muss man natürlich auch ein paar Worte zu den DLC verlieren. Und da wird es so ein klitzekleines bisschen problematisch. Grundsätzlich sind die DLC spitze, machen jede Menge Spaß, bieten einiges an Herausforderung und Belohnungen. Mein Favorit ist The Pitt, aber auch die anderen sind wirklich gut. Da gibt es nur einziges, ein winziges Problem. Wenn man die DLC kennt und weiß in welcher Reihenfolge man sie abarbeiten muss oder kann, dann ist das Ganze schon ein wenig wie ein Cheat Code für das Hauptspiel. Einige der Belohnungen, gerade aus Operation Anchorage und Mothership Zeta, bringen einen lässig soweit durch das Spiel, dass man Level 25 hat und kaum noch angreifbar ist. Hier muss der Spieler wirklich Selbstdisziplin haben oder irgendwann in Langeweile versinken.

Was bleibt - FO3 ist auch in 2025 ein solider Titel. Die GOTY ist immer mal wieder für einen Apfel und ein zu bekommen, so dass man nicht viel falsch macht, wenn es sich gönnt und reinschaut. Ich persönlich vergebe sechs von zehn Sternen, Abzüge durch die Probleme die weiter oben geschildert worden sind und lege jedem ans Herz das Spiel zu versuchen. Wirklich gut.

185180307.review:
Après deux épisodes en 3D isométrique et aux combats en tour par tour ayant marqué le CRPG, la licence a fait son retour en 2008 avec une nouvelle formule et un nouveau studio. En tant que grand fan des deux premiers épisodes, j'étais très curieux de découvrir ce qu'allait donner ce Fallout 3.
Un gros reproche a été fait par la communauté des fans concernant l'écriture de ce 3ᵉ opus et la qualité des quêtes, et je ne peux pas contredire ce qui a été dit : globalement, il y a moins de liberté et moins de possibilités pour résoudre les quêtes, qui se résument la plupart du temps à des combats FPS. Le mode SNAV permet cependant de mettre l'action en pause pour viser une zone précise, mais, temps réel oblige, c'est forcément moins tactique que ce que l'on a connu dans les deux premiers épisodes.

Cela étant dit, une fois ces reproches faits, je dois dire que j'ai passé un très bon moment sur ce Fallout 3 et qu'il a su offrir quelques moments mémorables.
La 3D permet d'apporter une immersion plus profonde dans les terres désolées et de rendre ce monde plus palpable. Les déplacements en passant par les réseaux d'égouts et de métros sont également une nouveauté bienvenue, et l'histoire ainsi que le lore sont très intéressants.

Si la sortie de Fallout 3 a pu diviser un peu les fans, avec le recul, il s'agit d'un très bon RPG qui a su faire progresser la franchise, son lore et ses mécaniques de jeu. Je pense bien le relancer dans un futur plus ou moins proche.

185055633.review:
The Game of the Year (GOTY) Edition of Fallout 3 delivers the definitive Fallout 3 experience, enhanced with all five DLCs. From exploring the eerie wastelands in "Point Lookout" to the high-tech battles in "Mothership Zeta," each DLC adds unique and thrilling chapters to the story.

Immersive DLCs The included DLCs elevate the game's depth and replayability. Whether it's the strategic and intense "Operation: Anchorage" or the narrative-rich "Broken Steel," the additional content keeps the adventure fresh and engaging.

Enhanced Arsenal The DLCs introduce an impressive array of new weapons, many of which surpass the base game's arsenal. The Tesla Cannon, Gauss Rifle, and other advanced weaponry provide players with a satisfying upgrade, making combat more exhilarating and varied.

Room for Improvement The one downside I've encountered is the inconsistency in tracking playtime. Despite hours of immersion, the game sometimes oddly shows just a few minutes played. It's a minor glitch in an otherwise seamless experience, but it's worth noting.

Conclusion Overall, Fallout 3 GOTY Edition is a must-have for any fan of the series. The added DLCs provide substantial content, enhancing the narrative and gameplay. Despite the minor issue with playtime tracking, this edition offers an unparalleled journey through the wasteland that fans and newcomers alike will appreciate.

184843014.review:
通过TTW模组通关了3的本体以及望海岸和匹特保两个DLC...怎么说呢？(至于为啥不玩原版而去玩TTW...看下原版评论就知道了)

原本以为剧本口碑爆炸的FNV是站在巨人肩膀上更进一步，玩下来感觉就是FNV在侏儒的肩膀上好不容易搭建起来了一座通天巴别塔但是完事儿却还被杯赛背刺了一刀（好奇为啥这么说的可以搜一下当初FNV MC均分84所以B社没法奖金的瓜，看看现今NV的口碑就知道当时面对这个游戏游媒普遍因为无法确定玩家口风所以采取了保守的打分策略），总体论调，3代还不如辐射4。

别的不说就说剧本把，本体主线以“净水计划”为主轴讲述英克雷和兄弟会的纷争，但是两个派系的描述却是非黑即白。

英克雷被描述成“阿美袁世凯”，专门窃取胜利果实，还爱大搞类种族主义的纯血人类至上论，就差把“我是反派，快来杀我”刻脑门儿上了，更搞笑的是明明是一个高度集权的政府暗影部门，甚至首领还是美国总统，本作里的英克雷总统却是个赛博花瓶，根本压不住手底下人，派系内斗不断，甚至光凭主角两句嘴炮就能让总统直接原地自爆总基地，传说中的“阿美影卫”就这么个草台班子？对比起来，辐射4删减的英克雷线（Mod已有还原），起码初见面时满嘴“重建美国”并没有像本作英克雷一样草台反派的既视感，虽然还是阴谋论影卫那套经典形象，但不至于开局就让玩家觉得跟3代这般坏的这么纯粹。

还有兄弟会，明明是一个不择手段的科技至上派系，3代里却把兄弟会写成了首都废土的救世主——无论是开头在变种人埋伏里支援主角这个“平民”，还是到后面反抗超级变种人、协助“净水计划”，一直到结尾开始向首都废土分发纯水的剧情，3代里兄弟会形象简直是“英雄光辉洒满DC，长(将)老(军)恩情永记在心”，不知道的还以为是朝鲜人写的金胖子呢。再来看看辐射4的兄弟会，出场就是大飞艇和严苛的军队氛围，压迫感直接给你拉满，再到后面哪怕是功绩累累的圣骑士丹斯，发现他是合成人时麦克森长老也会毫不留情的下达处决指令，冷酷无情的铁腕统治形象可比3代的圣父会有魅力多了。

而且抛开派系形象就看剧情编排上的道德抉择设计，4代学院的阴谋简直是一根搅屎棍，义勇兵、兄弟会、铁路全被卷进来了，这种群像剧情的派系刻画更容易写出道德抉择而不容易干出二元化的剧情，更何况学院还给了尚恩这一矛盾点，而3代直系亲属直接被英克雷干死让玩家恨上加恨，光这一点区别我觉得4代就要胜过3代的主轴剧情。

再来谈谈通关的匹特堡和望海岸DLC（望海岸4代也有复刻Mod，嫌弃3代那个画质和反人类操作的话可以试试4代的复刻Mod），同样是每个DLC两股势力对抗，但是如果本体是非黑即白的话，DLC就是除了黑还是黑，一路黑到底，帮哪个都会让你感觉非常不爽，至于道德纠结感？不存在的，这剧情写的你能忍住不屠图就不错了...可以说这剧情连核子世界都不如....更不要提远港了...

不过3代剧本也不是没有惊喜，起码3代的剧本已经给4代的开展埋下了伏笔（铆钉城合成人出逃事件以及铁路和学院的初亮相已经给4代联邦废土的风起云涌扇起一阵小旋风了），先玩4代再玩3代碰到这个场景确实可以会心一笑，但是说实话如果先玩4的话，哪怕抛开画质不看，3代模糊的引导，跳脱的内容分布，以及缺少线索记录设计导致容易错过支线剧情，基本可以说没有的潜行，对Modding非常不友好的32位程序等等...只能说游戏工业在设计和技术上的快速发展确实让辐射3玩上去太过原始了。

个人感觉如果是素体辐射4，基本比辐射3优秀上那么一点点，毕竟4代素体实在是太半成品了，但如果是Mod过的辐射4，尤其是狂野波士顿版辐射4...那抱歉，辐射3基本只能给4提鞋了。

鉴于和辐射4素体版半斤对八两五十步笑百步，而我又给了辐射4好评，那么辐射3我也给好评吧。到时候等打完剩下的3个DLC，就来拜玩一下好评如潮的NV究竟是如何超神的一个剧本。

但是如果你拿星空来和辐射3对比的话，我推荐辐射3，星空给辐射3提鞋都不配，星空就是赛博雅达利，是欧美游戏工业退步十几年开发水平开发出来的连垃圾都不如的游戏。

184750665.review:
Fallout 3 is a very controversial game. Despite its numerous issues, many people enjoy it.

Technically, the game has aged poorly. Not only does it struggle to run on modern hardware, but it also looks bad. The issue isn't with the textures or models but with the color grading, which was common in games of that era. The developers aimed to create a grim atmosphere by adding a gray-brown filter but overdid it. I’m not asking for vibrant colors like in Fallout 4, but it’s crucial for a game where you spend dozens of hours to be visually appealing. Although the game world is detailed, the color filters make many locations lose their diversity, and the gray tones quickly become tiring.

That said, the color grading doesn’t make Fallout 3 a truly grim game. While exploring the world, it does create a dense post-apocalyptic atmosphere of traveling through a ruined wasteland, but this is undermined by most quests, which often devolve into absurdity, much like the main storyline.

Despite this contrast, the side quests are the main reason to play Fallout 3. They lack proper role-playing depth and rarely interact with the RPG system, but they are often nonlinear, have intriguing concepts, and feature interesting characters.

Additionally, Fallout 3 is a first-person shooter where you have to shoot a lot. Unfortunately, shooting is another weak aspect of the game, alongside graphics and the main story. Weapons have random spread, weak recoil, unremarkable sound design, and dull models. This makes combat uninteresting, which is unforgivable for a game of this kind.

A few words about the DLCs: Operation: Anchorage, Broken Steel, and Mothership Zeta are dull, linear shooters that take only a few hours and can be skipped. However, The Pitt and Point Lookout are so good that they alone make the game worth playing. Both feature a near-horror atmosphere and captivating stories.

In conclusion, I believe Fallout 3 is worth playing for the side quests, world exploration, and two DLCs. However, you’ll need to spend a day installing mods to bring the game’s technical side up to an acceptable level.

184602537.review:
It's pretty decent. Performance is usually good, though tabbing out is not recommended as it tends to freeze and/or crash. 
Main story- uninteresting, one-note, and somehow too short and drags on forever. Choices don't really matter. 4/10 at best.
Operation Anchorage DLC- excellent, like Metal Gear Solid but Fallout. Very fun, also includes the best armor in the game. 8/10.
Mothership Zeta DLC- meh. Story's alright, but 90% of the ship is locked off after you finish the story so if you forgot to loot, too bad. Perks are alright, weapons are great, enemies are boring. 5/10.
The Pitt DLC- decent story, okay map, excellent quest rewards. Has one of the best guns in the game. Worth getting for the Metal Blaster alone. Also the home of the infamous Steel Ingot. 6.5/10.
Point Lookout DLC- not too bad. Main story is a bit bland but interesting enough. Adds some good weapons. Map feels very empty. 6/10.
Broken Steel DLC- boring. Story is perhaps the least engaging I have ever seen, the gameplay is repetitive, though it is by far the most profitable since it's full of Enclave soldiers whose gear is quite valuable. Also adds some very useful perks, allowing you to reach max SPECIAL stats with some patience. 8/10 perks, 2/10 everything else.
Overall: Decent game, I had fun. The side content is invariably significantly more interesting than the main story. There's some seriously good side quests. Having played New Vegas first, though, this game just feels like a prototype. There's several things that feel glaringly lacking. But if you play this first, or don't play new Vegas at all, it'll stand on its own fairly well. Definitely don't do this *after* New Vegas though, it'll definitely hurt your experience. I can see why it's gotten such criticism but I don't think it deserves the hate. Not the worst Bethesda game. 5/10.

Fallout 3 Review: A Timeless Classic

🌟 Rating: Beyond Legendary 🌟

I cannot express how much I LOVE Fallout 3. This game is not just a masterpiece; it’s one of my all-time favorite games, and I’ve beaten it countless times—with and without mods. No matter how many hours I pour into it, the magic never fades.

The storyline is unforgettable, pulling you into the post-apocalyptic world of the Capital Wasteland with its gripping narrative and morally complex choices. Every decision you make carries weight, and the branching paths ensure each playthrough feels fresh. Exploring this vast, crumbling world filled with danger, beauty, and the echoes of a lost civilization never gets old.

And let’s not forget the music! I mean, how can you not feel a rush of nostalgia every time you hear "I Don’t Want to Set the World on Fire"? The soundtrack alone is worth the price of admission, capturing the melancholy and hope of a world trying to rebuild from the ashes.

The Fallout franchise holds a special place in my heart, but Fallout 3 is where my love truly burns brightest. From its unforgettable characters like Three Dog, to the eerie beauty of the Wasteland, to the endless freedom to play the way you want—it’s simply perfect.

Mods or vanilla, I’ll always come back to it. If you’ve never played it, what are you waiting for? Step out of Vault 101 and start a flame in your heart—you’ll never want to leave. 💚💥

Fallout 3 isn’t just a game; it’s a journey, an adventure, and a love letter to everything Fallout stands for. It’s a beacon of what RPGs should strive to be. And for me, it will always be x99999 LOVE. 🛠️✨

184367134.review:
Don't let the "0.5 hrs on record" fool you. I have around 130 hours total (and more on the original Xbox 360 version). The reason for this is the (almost) need for mods and I used the mod manager to launch the game. 

Anyway, Fallout 3 is excellent in some areas, terrible in others, and mediocre in most. Below is a collection of reviews I wrote at the time of completion back in 2020. [b] They contain spoilers. [/b]

[h3] Fallout 3 [/h3]
It took a lot of mods (and about 4-5 hours of tinkering) to get this to work properly and look decent, but it has definitely been worth it. I got about halfway through back in the day, and it's been so much fun to relive it and actually finish the game. Well, the base game anyway. I've completed all the named sidequests as well and they are mostly great. Just a lot of creativity in the situations and characters. It's not super serious and gets pretty goofy and I'm not sure that was intentional. The combat can be very one-note, with not a lot of variety beyond "shoot the thing". The game also crashes constantly, not to mention the bugs. It's still a ton of fun to wander the wastes and find random, wacky shit to mess with.

[h3] Operation Anchorage [/h3]
Fun little distraction. I like the concept better than the execution, however, as it suggests you can do the first mission using stealth. You can't. It's basically a few missions from a WWII FPS game (in a VR simulation), where you only get to keep the winterized version of the T-51b power armor that I already got from a sidequest in the main game. The ending kinda surprised me, but overall, pretty meh.

[h3] The Pitt [/h3]
I liked the concept of infiltrating a slaver colony as a slave, and doing sneaky stuff to lead a rebellion and get the cure for a disease affecting everyone in the area. However, the execution leaves a bit to be desired. Too many logic-breaking sequences, bugs, and simplistic interactions prevented me from truly role-playing. If this had been treated as a more fleshed out expansion, I think it could have been great. As it stands, it's a flawed, yet inventive and worthwhile questline that offers new weapons and armor, and the ability to convert ammo, which is much appreciated.

[h3] Broken Steel [/h3]
Solid action romp taking out Enclave installations and getting the Tesla Cannon, which is legit. Seeing Liberty Prime get bombed to hell was a surprise as I think he's one of the coolest parts of the game (he has the best one-liners, hands down). I liked the the finale where you have to board a mobile command station and blow everything up. The medic power armor is also one of the coolest armors in the game. Definitely a good followup to the main questline.

[h3] Point Lookout [/h3]
I like the new area and the vibe it gives. The mutated humans are great and makes me wonder why they weren't in the main game. The main quest is actually pretty interesting but I feel like more could have been done with it. The various sidequests fit the area well and offered plenty to do. Very recommended.

[h3] Mothership Zeta [/h3]
What a massive disappointment. I was expecting interaction beyond just shooting aliens in the face over and over again, but that's all you get here. I hated the little girl that leads you around by the nose (the logic behind her knowledge of the ship hurts to think about), but the cryo chamber was a good idea with a few interesting characters. It's too bad they don't do much with them. The ending is an interesting concept, but once again falls flat on its alien face when executing. Also, the shield aliens hit super hard and take way too many hits to go down. I burned through over 50 stimpaks (ended the DLC with none) by the end. If they had some mechanic for dropping their shields a la the Elites in Halo, it would have been more engaging. Not a fan of this one.

184365859.review:
不推荐没接触过辐射系列的玩家游玩
我是先玩的4，nv，再玩的3
首先是老生常谈的游戏年代造成的一系列问题，都是老生常谈的话题了不再赘述
其次就是系统对比4和nv要简陋很多，有点无聊
最重要的一点是支线任务设计和兴趣点内容填充相当匮乏，探索地图给我带来的不是了解未知世界的快感或者获取丰富奖励，酷炫武器的刺激，而是一到一个新地点先杀一万个怪然后翻个底朝天屁也没有还得原路返回的疲惫。一半以上的可以进入的房屋，虽然设计了相当复杂的空间，但是一来没有任务指引，二来地图中也没有叙事要素，等我把整个楼翻个底朝天后，我还是连这个楼到底是干啥的都不知道，完完全全没有任何目标引导，去探楼纯粹是因为强迫症犯了。就算是让我去十松庄通一万个马桶，我也觉得比钻破楼和破地铁有代入感，起码牢翔还会谢两句给我个二百瓶盖。说到地铁，市区里的地铁设计师没吃过是真设计不出这么有味儿的，谁玩谁知道。
此外npc设计上有很大问题，很多有多个npc的场景，其实都只有一套选项，四五个npc都只能问一个问题然后听不同的配音演员把一句话颠来倒去的重新说一遍或者表达“我不知道”，对话的趣味性大大降低了，还不如不设这几个有名有姓的复制人。与之相关的就是npc事件和任务太少了，一个城镇基本就一个事件，内容量太少。
我能理解作为3d初作其包含的奠基意义，我也能体会到相对于4更高的立意，同时对于游戏中一些有巧思的场景设计，像开头的童年视角，虚拟城镇，dlc的中国间谍任务也着实让我感到有趣，但这毕竟是一款开放世界游戏，这些优点不能掩盖作为开放世界游戏在探索要素上严重的内容缩水和不足。
既然这篇评测是“值不值得向没玩过的玩家推荐”而不是“是不是一款好游戏”，那么我的答案就是：我不推荐没有接触过辐射系列的新玩家，尤其是近几年刚刚接触游戏的玩家游玩该游戏，毕竟该玩的早玩过了，我说这些也没什么意义，没玩过的才会来翻评论。而对于接触过辐射4的玩家，我只推荐过一遍主线和几个dlc。如果只是过主线的话，想必体验应该还ok，但话又说回来，既然只有主线优秀，那做成开放世界何意味呢？

So I returned to this game recently to do a full playthrough. Got a fair bit of the way through! Got to level 15 and had a crash when I leveled up. Strange, haven't had this up untill now, and I don't run too many mods either. Tried uninstalling them, no fix. Tried completely wiping my fallout 3 installation and redoing it. No fix. Loaded old saves and found that this is a bug on ALL my saves, even ones at the entrance to vault 101 and such. Also noticed that whenever I load a save while I'm in game, it completely freezes my pc, if it wasn't for me having two moniters, I'd have to kill the power to my whole system.

I look online for hours, trying fixes with no resolution. Finally I learn about downgrading the game from a patch from a few years ago??? It got patched??? Weird. I do that, and now the entire game won't launch, even on fresh install, as well as installing crash fixes and F3SE and everything. Honestly, I have no energy left to even give a damn. Next thing you know, they'll update Morrowind and Oblivion and break those as well. Same for Vegas. Hell, maybe they'll have the guts to break the original Fallout games as well. 

Stop touching the damn game Bethesda. This worked for YEARS, and my first playthrough after their "patch", it breaks entirely and becomes unplayable.

184261264.review:
Это мой первый опыт в Фоллауте, и игра мне очень понравилась. Давно я не испытывал столько эмоций от игры. 
Так же для меня было приятно увидеть тот факт, что, даже маленькие детали в игре просчитаны. 
К примеру, когда я впервые пришёл в Мегатонну, я встретил человека в костюме, который предложил взорвать бомбу в центре города. Но когда я отказался и подошёл к шерифу города, я смог ему об этом сказать. 
В современных играх такого нету. Или если есть, но дают сильный намёк на то, что я мог бы об этом поговорить с кем то другим. 
Хотя у игры есть и минусы. Я встретил много багов во время игры. К примеру, у меня зависала намертво игра при выходе из бункера. Позже, когда я уже всё починил и спокойно играл, у меня могло в рандомный момент зависнуть намертво и не отлагать. И если я сворачивал игру, то тоже мог произойти вылет. Но даже при наличии кучи багов мне игра в общем и целом понравилась!
Всех с новым годом!

184169979.review:
I can't, in good conscience, recommend this version of Fallout 3.
Fallout 3 is a good game, and I'd like to make myself clear: you should play it! But definitely not the Steam version. Fallout 3 on steam is a buggy mess, and there's a list of about 100 fixes which will never work. Before you even start the game, FO3 crashes everytime you start it, so you have to go into the files and install fixes.
In your first hour playing, you will enjoy the game but when you save and load your game, it will crash. You cannot play any of your saved games, the only thing that will work is a load game. 
SO, if you want to play Fallout 3, play ANY other version. Xbox 360 (or backwards compatible), GOG, literally any version that is not this steam version.

183696012.review:
60+ Hours on Vanilla Fallout 3 - XBOX 360, RATING: 7.5/10

20 Hours on Modded Fallout 3 - Steam / PC & Many more to come . . . RATING: 8.5/10

Straight up, I recommend Fallout 3 GOTY! 

I have put an abhorrent amount of hours into Vanilla Fallout 3 and now that I can play it on PC I am repeating the process with MODS!!!

The game is good and fun, love the story and RPG mechanics, vanilla has dated combat to today's standard but not a terrible experience especially late game. (level 14 onwards)

If you are getting this on PC and you want to experience the game Vanilla ( great idea for a first play through), keep in mind you will have to do some minor modding to get the game to run optimally and to remove bugs that Bethesda just left in the game. 

- FOSE
- Updated Unofficial Patch Fallout 3
- Unofficial Fallout 3 ESM Patcher

- LStewie AL's Tweaks (Optional)

Doing this, on top of making it so you can ACTUALLY play the game will also give you an introduction to modding so when you do come back around to do it, you're not lost in the sauce. 

It won't take long, solid 20 - 30 minutes and boom!

Choose not to do this and don't be surprised if you're one of the reviews complaining that the game is not running or it keeps crashing.

183617377.review:
(I played this game through the Tale of Two Wastelands Mod for Fallout: New Vegas, so my playtime isn't accurate and is closer to 120-ish hours.)

That said, this game ROCKS... for the most part. I mean, about 80% of the writing is kind of stupid. The main story is awful, and the majority of quests are either nonsensical or just poorly executed, further showcasing why Bethesda never really understood Fallout or its tone. However, considering this is their first adaptation of the franchise, it's more understandable.

The DLC lineup is also pretty mediocre. Point Lookout stands out as the exception, offering an eerie atmosphere and some solid storytelling. The rest? Forgettable at best, and in the case of The Pitt, downright awful.

Fallout 3 has absolutely aged like a milk-wine concoction: there's still some fermentation, but a hint of curdling (from... the milk). 7/10.

183610343.review: I finally beat the game. In its entirety (all the DLCs)  I go this game many years ago when I was a lot younger by this odd kid I met in school, When I got home from school I booted up my PS3 and put the disk in and well this game has to be the most Darkest, Horrific, Zany, Awesome and memorable game of all time for me. The atmosphere for me is so nerve wrecking and unforgiving, from the soulless barren wastes to the eerie dark damp underground that is the metro that is so easy to get lost in. This game made me fall in love with it, I remember I was often quiet scared to play this game on my own and would feel so much better if I had a friend over to watch me play for a bit just so I could make some progress just so I didn't feel alone. Its such a shame that the series gets mistreated by Bethesda from time to time but I suppose theirs only so much the fans can do about it, my only other major complaint isn't technically about the game itself more so the fan base, New Vegas players are so toxic about Fallout 3 its like they literally cannot reside in the same world as someone who likes another Fallout instead they'd rather attack new people to the franchise then try to accept them for having an alternate opinion to theirs scaring away new potential people, this isn't gonna help the community grow at all and will ultimately be the reason this amazing franchise will die out by gate keeping so viciously, I love fallout 3 its literally changed my life and I absolutely love the fact that the community for the most part shares the same view.
